cheatsheet.title: Using the Local OS user registry

intro.description:
Before configuring WebSphere to use the local operating systems user registry, you need to know the user name (ID) and password that will be used by the application server as its own identity when setting up authorization policy and when authenticating to other application servers (for example, in a WebSphere Application Server Network Deployment environment).

When using the Local OS user registry with WebSphere for z/OS, user name and password are not specified through WebSphere administrative facilities. Rather, the user name associated with the server is configured through the administrative facilities of the platform security product. Read InfoCenter article Local operating system user registries for information on configuring server identities on z/OS.

This user can be any valid user in the user registry. This user will be referred to as either a product security server ID, a server ID or a server user ID in the documentation. See Configuring local operating system user registries in the Information Center for more information.

item.title: Enter user name and password
item.description:
To enter the server user ID and password:
  1. Click to perform loads the Local OS user registry configuration page.
  2. Enter the server user ID and password
  3. Press Ok to submit the changes.
